name: Andromeda
description: The Chained Maiden. Home to our nearest galaxy neighbor.

name: The Air Pump
description: A faint southern constellation created in the 18th century.

name: The Bird of Paradise
description: Small constellation near the south celestial pole.

name: The Water Bearer
description: One of the oldest recognized constellations along the zodiac.

name: The Eagle
description: It carries Zeus's thunderbolts. Contains the bright star Altair.

name: The Altar
description: Located between Scorpius and Triangulum Australe.

name: The Ram
description: The first sign of the zodiac, representing the Golden Fleece.

name: The Charioteer
description: Distinctive pentagon shape, containing the bright star Capella.

name: The Herdsman
description: Contains Arcturus, the brightest star in the northern hemisphere.

name: The Chisel
description: A faint constellation in the southern sky.

name: The Giraffe
description: A large but faint constellation in the northern sky.

name: The Crab
description: Faintest zodiac sign, home to the Beehive Cluster.

name: The Hunting Dogs
description: Represents the dogs of Boötes the Herdsman.

name: The Great Dog
description: Contains Sirius, the brightest star in the night sky.

name: The Lesser Dog
description: Small constellation containing the bright star Procyon.

name: The Sea Goat
description: One of the zodiac constellations, often depicted as a goat-fish.

name: The Keel
description: Part of the ship Argo Navis; contains Canopus.

name: Cassiopeia
description: The Queen. Famous for its W-shape in the northern sky.

name: The Centaur
description: Large southern constellation containing Alpha Centauri.

name: The King
description: Shaped like a house, represents the King of Aethiopia.

name: The Sea Monster
description: The fourth largest constellation in the sky.

name: The Chameleon
description: A small constellation near the south celestial pole.

name: The Compass
description: Defines the shape of a drafting tool.

name: The Dove
description: Represents Noah's dove released from the Ark.

name: Berenice's Hair
description: The only constellation named after a historical figure.

name: The Southern Crown
description: A distinctive wreath shape in the southern sky.

name: The Northern Crown
description: A small, clear semi-circle of stars.

name: The Crow
description: A small quadrilateral shape situated near Virgo.

name: The Cup
description: Represents the cup of the god Apollo.

name: The Southern Cross
description: The smallest but one of the most famous constellations.

name: The Swan
description: Also known as the Northern Cross, flying through the Milky Way.

name: The Dolphin
description: A small, distinct diamond-shaped constellation.

name: The Dolphinfish
description: Home to most of the Large Magellanic Cloud.

name: The Dragon
description: Winds around the Little Bear in the northern sky.

name: The Little Horse
description: The second smallest constellation.

name: The River
description: A long winding line of stars ending in the bright star Achernar.

name: The Furnace
description: Named after a chemical furnace.

name: The Twins
description: Castor and Pollux are the main bright stars.

name: The Crane
description: A prominent bird in the southern sky.

name: Hercules
description: The Hero. Fifth largest constellation, contains M13 cluster.

name: The Pendulum Clock
description: A faint southern constellation.

name: The Water Snake
description: The largest and longest of all 88 constellations.

name: The Male Water Snake
description: A small constellation near the Small Magellanic Cloud.

name: The Indian
description: A constellation in the southern sky.

name: The Lizard
description: A small zig-zag line of stars.

name: The Lion
description: Zodiac sign recognizable by the 'sickle' shape.

name: The Little Lion
description: A faint constellation situated between Leo and Ursa Major.

name: The Hare
description: A rabbit being chased by Orion's hunting dogs.

name: The Scales
description: The only inanimate object in the zodiac.

name: The Wolf
description: Victim of the Centaur in the southern sky.

name: The Lynx
description: A faint line of stars, requiring 'lynx eyes' to see.

name: The Lyre
description: Home to Vega, one of the brightest stars in the sky.

name: Table Mountain
description: The faintest of all constellations, near the south pole.

name: The Microscope
description: A faint constellation in the southern sky.

name: The Unicorn
description: A faint constellation found inside the Winter Triangle.

name: The Fly
description: A small southern constellation.

name: The Level
description: Represents a carpenter's square.

name: The Octant
description: Contains the South Celestial Pole.

name: The Serpent Bearer
description: Often called the 13th sign of the zodiac.

name: Orion
description: The Hunter. The most recognizable winter constellation.

name: The Peacock
description: Known for its bright star Peacock.

name: The Winged Horse
description: Famous for the Great Square of Pegasus.

name: Perseus
description: The Hero who saved Andromeda. Contains the star Algol.

name: The Phoenix
description: A mythical bird that rises from its own ashes.

name: The Painter's Easel
description: A faint southern constellation.

name: The Fishes
description: Two fish tied by a cord; a zodiac constellation.

name: The Southern Fish
description: Contains the bright star Fomalhaut.

name: The Poop Deck
description: The stern of the ship Argo Navis.

name: The Compass
description: Represents the mariner's compass of Argo Navis.

name: The Reticle
description: Represents the net in a telescope eyepiece.

name: The Arrow
description: The third smallest constellation.

name: The Archer
description: Marks the center of the Milky Way galaxy.

name: The Scorpion
description: A distinctive J-shaped constellation in the southern sky.

name: The Sculptor
description: Contains the South Galactic Pole.

name: The Shield
description: A small cloud of stars in the Milky Way.

name: The Serpent
description: The only constellation split into two separate parts.

name: The Sextant
description: A faint equatorial constellation.

name: The Bull
description: Contains the red star Aldebaran and the Pleiades cluster.

name: The Telescope
description: A small constellation in the southern sky.

name: The Triangle
description: Contains the Triangulum Galaxy (M33).

name: The Southern Triangle
description: A distinct equilateral triangle in the south.

name: The Toucan
description: Home to the Small Magellanic Cloud.

name: The Great Bear
description: Contains the famous Big Dipper asterism.

name: The Little Bear
description: Contains Polaris, the North Star.

name: The Sails
description: The sails of the ship Argo Navis.

name: The Virgin
description: The second largest constellation, rich in galaxies.

name: The Flying Fish
description: Represents a fish gliding through the air.

name: The Fox
description: A faint constellation containing the Dumbbell Nebula.
